xxl.core.io.fat

Class FAT

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.fat.FAT

  • public class FAT
extends Object
    This class represents the FAT (File Allocation Table) this can be a FAT12, FAT16, or FAT32.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  FAT.FreeMemoryManagement
      This class is used to make the free memory management.

      • CLN_SHUT_BIT_MASK_FAT16

        public static final int CLN_SHUT_BIT_MASK_FAT16
        If bit is 1, volume is clean. If bit is 0 volume is dirty. This indicates that the file system driver did not dismount properly the volume the last time it was mounted. You should run Scandisk on it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLN_SHUT_BIT_MASK_FAT32

        public static final long CLN_SHUT_BIT_MASK_FAT32
        If bit is 1, volume is clean. If bit is 0 volume is dirty. This indicates that the file system driver did not dismount properly the volume the last it was mounted. You should run Scandisk on it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HRD_ERR_BIT_MASK_FAT16

        public static final int HRD_ERR_BIT_MASK_FAT16
        If this bit is 1, no disk read/write errors were encountered. If this bit is 0, the file system driver encountered a disk I/O error on the volume the last time it was mounted, which is an indicator that some sectors may have gone bad on the volume. You should run Scandisk on it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HRD_ERR_BIT_MASK_FAT32

        public static final long HRD_ERR_BIT_MASK_FAT32
        If this bit is 1, no disk read/write errors were encountered. If this bit is 0, the file system driver encountered a disk I/O error on the volume the last time it was mounted, which is an indicator that some sectors may have gone bad on the volume. You should run Scandisk on it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHECK_BAD_CLUSTERS

        public static final byte CHECK_BAD_CLUSTERS
        Flag which indicates that the checkdisk/scandisk method should scan for bad clusters.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FAT

        public FAT(FATDevice device,
           BPB bpb)
        Create an instance of this object. The constructor will boot the fat and initialize the free memory management with all found free clusters.
        Parameters:
        device - an object of the FATDevice where this FAT is active.
        bpb - the BPB of the device.

      • FAT

        public FAT(FATDevice device,
           BPB bpb,
           byte fatType)
    throws InitializationException
        Create an instance of this object. This constructor will format the fat blocks and initialize the free memory management with all free clusters.
        Parameters:
        device - an object of the FATDevice where this FAT is active.
        bpb - the BPB of the device.
        fatType - the type of fat that should be created.
        Throws:
        InitializationException - in case this object couldn't be initialized.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeFat

        protected void initializeFat()
                      throws InitializationException
        Initialize the FAT, i.e. the free list of data. This method is not automatically called by constructors, because of the checkdisk() method. The checkdisk method needs ready initialized objects.
        Throws:
        InitializationException - in case the FAT couldn't be initialized.

      • fastFormat

        protected void fastFormat()
        Reinitialize the FAT structure only the entries that are marked as bad will remain, all others will be set to zero.

      • setHRD_ERR_BITToError

        protected void setHRD_ERR_BITToError()
        If one or more sectors couldn't be read/write properly the HRD_ERR_BIT should be set to error, so that the next time the device is booted a scandisk will be made. This method sets the HRD_ERR_BIT to error.

      • isBadMark

        public boolean isBadMark(long content)
        Check if the given content equals a BAD_CLUSTER_X mark.
        Parameters:
        content - a value from the FAT structure.
        Returns:
        true in case content equals a BAD_CLUSTER_X mark; false otherwise.

      • unmount

        protected void unmount()
        Unmount the fat. This method is called by the file system, never call this method directly.
        See Also:
        FileSystem.shutDown(), FileSystem.unmount(java.lang.String deviceName)

      • getFatContent

        protected long getFatContent(long clusterNumber,
                             byte[] fatBuffer)
        This method is the same as getFatContent(clusterNumber) except that the whole fat byte array is known. It's used by the initialization method to speed up the boot process.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - the number of cluster.
        fatBuffer - the FAT as byte array.
        Returns:
        the value at the FAT indexed by clusterNumber.

      • getFatContent

        public long getFatContent(long clusterNumber)
        Get the FAT content for the given clusterNumber.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - is the index in the FAT
        Returns:
        the FAT content for the given clusterNumber.

      • getFatContent

        protected long getFatContent(long clusterNumber,
                             int fatNumber)
        Get the FAT content for the given clusterNumber from the given fatNumber.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - is the index in the FAT
        fatNumber - is the number of the FAT that is used.
        Returns:
        the FAT content for the given clusterNumber and fatNumber.

      • setFatEocMark

        protected void setFatEocMark(long clusterNumber)
        Set the entry of FAT given by clusterNumber with EOC_MARK.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - the index of the FAT that should set with the EOC_MARK.

      • setBadMark

        protected void setBadMark(long clusterNumber)
        Mark the index given by clusterNumber as bad. From now on the cluster number associated with this index is not usable.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - the number of cluster.

      • setFatContent

        protected void setFatContent(long clusterNumber,
                             long content)
        Set the given content of the FAT at the given cluster number.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - is the cluster number at which the content is set.
        content - is data to store in the FAT at clusterNumber.

      • markSectorAsBad

        protected void markSectorAsBad(long sectorNumber)
        Mark the sector given by sectorNumber as no longer usable.
        Parameters:
        sectorNumber - the number of sector.

      • markClusterAsBad

        protected void markClusterAsBad(long clusterNumber)
        Mark the cluster given by clusterNumber as no longer usable.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - number of cluster.

      • addFreeClusters

        public void addFreeClusters(List freeClusterList)
        Add a list of free cluster numbers to the free memory management. All cluster numbers will be marked as free.
        Parameters:
        freeClusterList - a list of Long objects.

      • addFreeClustersMarkFirstAsEOC

        protected void addFreeClustersMarkFirstAsEOC(long startClusterNumber)
        Mark cluster numbers as free. The cluster number startClusterNumber gets the EOC_MARK all next numOfClusters clusters belonging to the cluster chain will be marked as free.
        Parameters:
        startClusterNumber - the cluster number to start.

      • addFreeClusters

        protected void addFreeClusters(long startClusterNumber)
        Mark cluster numbers as free beginning with the given startClusterNumber.
        Parameters:
        startClusterNumber - the cluster number to start.

      • getFreeClusters

        public List getFreeClusters(long numOfFreeClusters)
                     throws NotEnoughMemory
        Get a list of free cluster numbers as entries with a size of numOfFreeClusters. All allocated cluster numbers are automatically stored in the fat. In case there is not enough memory an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        numOfFreeClusters - is the number of free clusters.
        Returns:
        list with free cluster numbers as entries.
        Throws:
        NotEnoughMemory - in case there are not enough free clusters to support the query.

      • getFreeClusters

        public List getFreeClusters(long numOfFreeClusters,
                            long lastClusterNumber)
                     throws NotEnoughMemory
        Get a list of free cluster numbers as entries with a size of numOfFreeClusters. All allocated cluster numbers are automatically stored in the fat started at lastClusterNumber. In case there is not enough memory an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        numOfFreeClusters - the number of free clusters.
        lastClusterNumber - the last cluster number.
        Returns:
        list with free cluster numbers as entries.
        Throws:
        NotEnoughMemory - if there is not enough memory to support the query.

      • isLastCluster

        public boolean isLastCluster(long clusterNumber)
        Determine if the given clusterNumber points to an EOC_MARK, this depends on the fatType.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - the number of the cluster.
        Returns:
        true if the given clusterNumber equals an EOC_MARK otherwise false.

      • getFatType

        public byte getFatType()
        Return the type of FAT. The possible FAT types are FAT12, FAT16, or FAT32.
        Returns:
        the fat type.

      • checkdisk

        protected boolean checkdisk(byte[] fat)
        Check the cluster chains in the FAT and repair them.
        Parameters:
        fat - the FAT as byte array.
        Returns:
        true if the FAT could be repaired otherwise false.

      • checkdisk

        protected boolean checkdisk(byte[] fat,
                            byte flag)
        Parameters:
        fat - the FAT as byte array.
        flag - the flag indicates what kind of checkdisk is to do. Use CHECK_BAD_CLUSTERS as flag to check the disk surface for failers.
        Returns:
        true if the fat is corrected otherwise false.

      • checkDiskSurface

        public boolean checkDiskSurface()
        Check the surface of the disk.
        Returns:
        true if no disk error could be found or in case of an error the system will work properly with it, otherwise false.

      • getNumberOfFreeBytes

        public long getNumberOfFreeBytes()
        Return the total number of free bytes.
        Returns:
        the total number of free bytes.

      • getFSI

        protected FSI getFSI()
        Return the FSI object.
        Returns:
        the FSI object.

      • getFATSectorNumber

        public long getFATSectorNumber(int fatNumber)
        Debug method. Return the start sector number for the given fatNumber.
        Parameters:
        fatNumber - the given fatNumber.
        Returns:
        the start sector number.

      • getFAT

        public byte[] getFAT(int fatNumber)
        Debug method. Return the FAT fatNumber as byte array.
        Parameters:
        fatNumber - the given fatNumber.
        Returns:
        the FAT as byte array.
